definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: First off, allow us to apologize for the abductions.
sentences.chinese: 首先，請容許咱們爲綁票地球人而表達歉意。

sentences.english: The kidnapper strangled the child with a piece of string.
sentences.chinese: 綁票的人用一根繩子把這孩子勒死了。
我們將對綁匪的綁票行爲予以打擊。

sentences.english: A fake kidnapping can be just as emotionally disturbing as a real one to the parents.
sentences.chinese: 假綁票和真的一樣，讓父母情緒上受到波動。

sentences.english: Kidnapping is a big threat in the minds of super wealthy tycoons.
sentences.chinese: 對超級富豪而言，綁票是個大威脅。

sentences.english: Sailing under false colors, arson, kidnapping.
sentences.chinese: 以假旗幟航海，縱火，綁票。

sentences.english: the watchful snatcher dispatched a batch of combatants to the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 密切注重的綁票者發送一批兵士到艙口蓋。

sentences.english: If not, they will be hostages of the Peronist right and the opposition.
sentences.chinese: 如果失敗，他們將被貝隆主義者權利和反對者綁票。

definition: to carry out a vendetta against sb
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
